column1: A $2.4 million CARES Act grant from @US_EDA has been awarded to @LEDLouisiana to develop a technical assistance program and support business attraction and retention efforts across the state in response to adverse economic impacts caused by COVID-19.  https://t.co/Xmg9FYtAZK
On April 14 Congressmen Graves Richmond and Scalise announced MSY was receiving $42793389 available through the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act. (3/3) https://t.co/3bs1jecN3J

I joined @SBAJovita @LouisianaGov and several other stakeholders today for a roundtable to discuss PPP disaster assistance for the recent storms & helping our small businesses recover from COVID-19. https://t.co/belEqWYHUv

Over $2.1 million in CARES Act funding awarded to South Central Planning & Development Commission in Houma.  It will assist businesses impacted by COVID-19 in Assumption Lafourche St Charles St James St John the Baptist St Mary & Terrebonne parishes https://t.co/J7kimp8ydc

On Friday I testified at the Louisiana Economic Recovery Task Force and gave a federal update on COVID-19 relief.  We discussed the bills Congress has passed so far and the need to tailor the next round of legislation to those that need it the most. https://t.co/I9RFmxdRhj
Louisiana crawfish is now included in USDA's CFAP program.  This is part of the larger effort to keep Louisiana’s seafood industries afloat amidst COVID-19. (1/3)  https://t.co/b4Ix5Fw1y5

This is a win-win-win for Louisiana’s consumers families and local fishermen as COVID-19 has impacted everyone across the board.   For many families across Louisiana this will help feed food banks schools and households. (1/2) https://t.co/voDKjrS3Gg

We‘re still hurting from the Spillway opening last year & COVID-19 has made matters worse.   Today’s announcement will absolutely help bridge the gap between further loss for our processors & fleet & be the lifeline needed to stay afloat until our economy is back on track. (3/5) https://t.co/FKzFIN0yQZ

Protecting small businesses from frivolous lawsuits as they reopen to serve our communities must be a key piece of the next COVID-19 relief package.   My bill provides a bipartisan framework & I look forward to working with my colleagues in the House & Senate to find a solution. https://t.co/QTe0mVF4ZM

Providing legal safe harbor against frivolous lawsuits for small businesses as they reopen must be a key component of the next COVID-19 package.   Below @BPC_Bipartisan affirms to congressional leadership the protection my liability bill would offer. https://t.co/88fJjVWDVk

An enviro-bailout (at the cost of LA’s coast & future) is being pushed amidst COVID-19 oil price war record unemployment & national civil unrest.   Gulf Coast hurricane protection will be sacrificed for parks out West if @OutdoorsAct passes.   #FundLWCF #RestoreOurParks #GAOA https://t.co/IJAgROIius

Great to join LA Congressional Delegation members in welcoming @Mike_Pence to Louisiana this morning to discuss LA’s COVID-19 response.   I was also able to hitch a ride back tonight on Air Force Two to DC & talk legislative priorities for South Louisiana. https://t.co/J4W1iSBIt0

Met with FEMA Administrator Pete Gaynor this morning to talk flood recovery with the Baker School System leadership.  We also discussed COVID-related food insecurity Duplication of Benefits and flood protection. https://t.co/ZUkQXSZqbn

Small businesses & their hard workers need to reopen without the threat of frivolous lawsuits associated with COVID-19.  I introduced a bipartisan bill this week to offer this protection at the federal level. https://t.co/opo5U1MJNb

Baton Rouge receiving a $1.6 Million CARES Act Grant award to support homeless families and individuals who have been affected by COVID-19 in Baton Rouge. Louisiana's total share of this funding is $20923237.  More here:  https://t.co/kmfUrccYxC

Joined LA’s congressional delegation in support of Gov. Edwards’ request to POTUS to ensure Louisiana National Guard remains active through July 31 2020 in our response to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/m6P6xA4RE9

Nearly $100 mil awarded to help protect LA senior citizens from COVID-19.   Each of these senior citizens is someone’s parent grandparent relative or lifelong friend that has become part of one of the most vulnerable populations - not just stats.   https://t.co/WOREcgEcSa

NEW - $190 mil from HHS to boost COVID-19 testing in Louisiana. This record investment will help us to reopen quicker & safely. We need to focus on reopening economic recovery and getting our families working again - not prolonged decline.  More below:   https://t.co/QFbe6pOygs
Just last week we wrote to @FERChatterjee to show there is unrelated attacks on US energy independence which has no place during COVID-19. (2/2) https://t.co/vEGRshefRg

Explanation - These allocations are based on harvest. The west coast which sucked up all the previous funding experiences their main fishery season during the early spring & winter so their losses right now are larger due to COVID. (2/3)

NEWS - $2.3 Million provided to LA-06 to expand COVID-19 testing from HHS.   This funding for health centers is part of H.R. 266 – The Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act signed into law by POTUS on April 24th.   More below👇  https://t.co/gyIuq97caI

Joined LA congressmen in sending a letter to Gov. Edwards today urging him to apply federal coronavirus reopening guidelines on a local or regional basis. We highlighted that maintaining a statewide shutdown is causing undue harm to Louisiana families.    https://t.co/1aYHIcJbbj
TONIGHT‼️  Hosting a Telephone Town Hall to provide an update about the coronavirus situation and to answer questions.   ⏰ 5:10 PM CST 📞 877-229-8493  📲 ID CODE: 113947 https://t.co/54srKEH4ay

NEW FUNDS from HUD 👇  LA-06 is set to receive $1333817 in CARES Act Supplemental Public Housing Operating Funds with allocations going to 10 entities.   This builds on the previous $4.2 million in COVID-19 HUD grants announced.   More in link below:  https://t.co/XreEHKhCAD

Back on DC Current tomorrow morning with @brianhaldane on @talk1073.   We’ll be talking about the recent legislation in Congress future Coronavirus resources & other recent news in Louisiana.   ⏰ 7:30 AM (CST) https://t.co/UvyOyZ9TpJ

Coming up this morning at 10:30am:  I am calling @NewellWWL on @WWLAMFM to talk about Coronavirus issues PPP status and how things are looking for Louisiana right now. Tune in! https://t.co/4wcZlktXCb

The industry is battling issues from multiple angles – whether the decrease in demand caused by COVID-19 or an intentional supply glut caused by Russia Saudi Arabia and the OPEC nations. Looking forward to talking with DOI Sec. Bernhardt today to discuss problems we are seeing. https://t.co/8RgUchaeGn

NEARLY $300 MILLION in LA COVID-19 FUNDING:  Louisiana is receiving millions from coronavirus allocations to aid in recovery efforts. Read about a few new funding announcements in this press release.  https://t.co/1NnBdQ8me3
TODAY - Facebook Live‼️  Discussing updates on COVID-19 resources and recent news for LA-06.  ⏰: 12:00 PM (CST) https://t.co/rfdmM0NUxA

Joined @RepRichmond in sending a letter to @LouisianaGov highlighting racial disparities in LA’s COVID-19 data & the need for more research from the task force through an allocated portion of LA’s CARES Act share.  Full letter can be found here: https://t.co/aa8QCJBbxS https://t.co/iED8s4mF4g
Going on @talk1073 with @brianhaldane tomorrow morning to touch base on the Coronavirus response efforts. Tune in! https://t.co/xBfqbaqOfk

Through the CARES Act HHS announced today $11711336 in grants to support Louisiana’s older adults & people with disabilities during the COVID-19 emergency.  Link below for more about total funding:  https://t.co/Kncs9M3V6W  Louisiana breakdown below 👇 https://t.co/DP86eAJ3ER
‼️TUNE IN THIS AFTERNOON‼️  Join us for Facebook Live. Discussing updates on COVID-19 resources & recent news for LA-06.   ⏰: 1:00 PM (CST) https://t.co/mgjcCIqSLi
ICYMI - Louisiana's 6th Congressional District has received nearly $2 billion in recent funding and grants several are due to the COVID-19 relief efforts.   Read more below:  https://t.co/zDziQIDOgh
Going on @talk1073 with @brianhaldane tomorrow morning at 7:30 AM to touch base on the coronavirus response efforts. Tune in! https://t.co/PTWyl8iHUe
THIS MORNING - join us for a Facebook Live.   Discussing updates on COVID-19 resources and recent news for LA-06.  ⏰: 11:30 AM (CST) https://t.co/WUPAGv3J4I

So sorry to learn that coronavirus claimed the life of Louisiana Rep. Reggie Bagala - way too early. We were all looking forward to his contributions to the 2020 legislative session. Praying for his wife and family.
Going on @talk1073 with @brianhaldane tomorrow morning to touch base on the coronavirus response efforts. Tune in! https://t.co/XXUicYjvl8
Tune in tomorrow morning! Going on @1007TheTiger at 9AM with Roland Doucet to talk about the Coronavirus resources available to Louisiana and next steps forward. https://t.co/pICqYO4yBs

READ ⬇️  The LA Congressional Delegation stands ready to assist the Governor and local government leaders in the fight against COVID-19 by giving them the resources they need. Louisiana is strongest when we work together and I’m proud to lead this effort. https://t.co/uXcJHdMA2f
📺: TUNE IN to @WBRZ soon.  Will be discussing the PPP program Stimulus Checks and other  COVID-19 information. https://t.co/cE8p247HC7

U.S. oil producers are facing severe losses from the Coronavirus impacts. The Admin took a positive & crucial step toward stabilizing our domestic energy production & America’s energy independence. Now is the right time for the president to make this move. https://t.co/OrvIo0dI9o

READ: Letter to POTUS urging him to ensure DOBs don’t become an issue for any LA business that uses the SBA during the COVID-19 crisis. They are working diligently to fight this national emergency but I want to make sure that Louisianans are not penalized for taking out a loan https://t.co/vgm7Xpsuw1

Facebook Live TODAY:  Hosting with @SBAsouthcentral Regional Administrator Justin Crossie to discuss SBA capabilities during the COVID-19 recovery process.   We will discuss what SBA Economic Injury Disaster Loans entail & how we can help small businesses across the LA recover. https://t.co/zyD88bQ9zk
✅YES Vote on Coronavirus Funds. I am glad and shocked that Democrats came together with Republicans putting aside politics for a second to deliver a clean piece of policy.
